page.title: 20CRANHAM POPULATION
page.content: About a quarter of the population of Cranham are of pensionable age , a few of whom retired to the village , but most moved to the village during their working life and then stayed on. Most of the working age population have moved into the village since the 1950s when electricity reached the area and houses began to be purchased by outsiders. the majority of people work in Gloucester or Cheltenham with a few in Stroud or Cirencester. Most are in middle management and jobs range from Taxation to Customs and Excise, from Foreign Office and Government Communications to pollution control for Severn Trent Water Authority and fron salesmen to clerical workers. All join in the many social activities arranged in the village mainly by Village Hall or Friends of the School.
